pr_title: Remove the need of initial quoted module prefix for predeclared prefixes

timeline.message:
Remove the need of quoted module prefix
Remove the need of initial quoted module prefix for predefined module prefixes
Handle predeclared prefix of qualified identifier in lexer

timeline.bodyText: Shall keep the lexer unchanged and only change the parser?
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.message: Change parsing logic of predeclared prefix
Move test cases to predeclared-module-prefix directory

timeline.bodyText: since we are returning from if, we don't need the else block
timeline.author: SupunS
SupunS

timeline.bodyText:
predeclared-prefix should always be followed by colon and identifier right?
why don't we simply check colon and identifier in isQualifiedIdentifierPredeclaredPrefix and call parseQualifiedIdentifier here?
Then we can keep the rest of the method intact?
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: We provide recovery for the last identifier of the qualified identifier
replies.author: rdulmina

replies.bodyText:
I see. if there's a predeclared-qualified identifier we simply parse it otherwise we stick to the normal way of parsing.
wouldn't that make things simple in all places?
My concern is, whether it is worth doing recovery for missing identifier in  "predeclared-qualified identifier" at the cost of making the code base bit more complex.
replies.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: We agreed upon doing recovery for last identifier.
replies.author: lochana-chathura

timeline.bodyText:
Whenever we need to call parseTypeReference() we have to call it twice for identifier and isQualifiedIdentifierPredeclaredPrefix.
Shall we use a isTypeReferenceToken call so the current method has only one level of abstraction? i.e. whoever call parseTypeReference() does not need to worry about its internal composition.
timeline.author: lochana-chathura
lochana-chathura
lochana-chathura

timeline.message:
Fix issue in conditional expression parsing
Fix issue in conditional expression parsing with predeclared prefix
Fix issue in conditional expression parsing

timeline.author: lochana-chathura
lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: No, if isPredeclaredPrefix is true then identifier is already a BuiltinSimpleNameReference
replies.author: rdulmina

replies.bodyText: I mean we don't create the wrapper before calling this method. Instead we create the wrapper here?
replies.author: lochana-chathura
